meanings.definition: Scatter or spread (things) untidily over a surface or area.
meanings.sent1: She strown her toys all around the room.
meanings.sent2: The wind strown the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel strown acorns in the garden beds.
meanings.sent4: His careless actions strown chaos in the carefully organized event.
meanings.sent5: The artist strown colorful petals on the canvas, creating a vibrant masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: The strown petals added a touch of beauty to the path.
meanings.sent2: The strown seeds sprouted into lovely flowers.
meanings.sent3: The strown confetti made the floor look festive.
meanings.sent4: The strown leaves created a natural carpet in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The strown feathers gave the costume a whimsical touch.
